etymology.description: 金(金) (jīn, "metal") + 艮(艮) (gèn, "stubborn") = metal with phonetic element suggesting sound -> silver
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the meaning of 'metal' with a phonetic component to specify 'silver', a highly valued metal. The selection of 艮(艮) (gèn) as the phonetic part helps in pronunciation.
etymology.simplification: The character 銀(銀) was simplified to 银(銀) by replacing the traditional 金(金) with 钅(钅), a simpler, cursive shorthand form, retaining its meaning as a metal radical.

examples.chinese: 银是一种珍贵的金属(銀是一種珍貴的金屬)。
examples.pinyin: Yín shì yī zhǒng zhēnguì de jīnshǔ.

examples.chinese: 他用银制成的餐具(他用銀製成的餐具)，闪闪发光(閃閃發光)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yín zhìchéng de cānjù, shǎnshǎn fāguāng.
examples.english: The tableware made of silver sparkles.

examples.chinese: 雕刻师用银打造了精美的饰品(雕刻師用銀打造了精美的飾品)，赢得了许多赞誉(贏得了許多讚譽)。
examples.pinyin: Diāokè shī yòng yín dǎzào le jīngměi de shìpǐn, yíngdé le xǔduō zànyù.
examples.english: The sculptor crafted exquisite ornaments from silver, earning much praise.
